articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Plumes of smoke rose over Beirut, while airstrikes and artillery shelling inflicted heavy damage on buildings in southern Lebanon’s Bint Jbeil.
articles.title: Israel strikes Hezbollah areas in Beirut, southern Lebanon for third day

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: The letter said Israeli settlers have carried out over 1,270 recorded attacks in the West Bank.
articles.title: Democrats in Congress urge Biden to sanction Israelis over West Bank violence

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un guided a test of suicide drones and ordered a mass production of the aerial weapon, saying the introduction of such drones around the world requires an urgent update of military theory, state media said on Friday.
articles.title: North Korea leader Kim orders mass production of suicide drones, KCNA says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Fifteen people were killed in Israeli strikes on residential buildings in Damascus on Thursday, Syrian state media reported, and Israel said the attacks targeted military sites and the headquarters of the Islamic Jihad group.
articles.title: Israel says it hits military sites in Damascus, Syrian media says 15 killed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's Attorney General told Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to reevaluate the tenure of his far-right National Security Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir, citing his apparent interference in police matters, Israel's Channel 12 reported on Thursday.
articles.title: Israel's attorney general tells Netanyahu to reexamine police minister's role, media reports

articles.author: Michael Martina
articles.description: With his nomination of China hardliner Marco Rubio for secretary of state, U.S. President-elect Donald Trump has signaled his policy toward Beijing could go beyond his focus on tariffs and trade to a more hawkish stance towards China as the United States' top strategic rival.
articles.title: Rubio pick signals a Trump China policy that could go beyond tariffs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Families of Israeli hostages taken captive to Gaza by Islamist group Hamas urged U.S. President Joe Biden and President-elect Donald Trump on Thursday to work on a deal to free those still being held before winter.
articles.title: Families of Israeli hostages still in Gaza call on Trump, Biden to work together

articles.author: Eduardo Baptista, Marco Aquino, Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping arrived in Lima on Thursday, kicking off a week-long diplomatic blitz in Latin America by inaugurating the massive Chancay deep-water port, one of Beijing's most ambitious infrastructure investments in Latin America.
articles.title: China's Xi arrives in Lima for APEC, to open Pacific megaport

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian attack on Ukraine's Black Sea port of Odesa on Thursday struck a residential building, knocked out a heating supply boiler plant and damaged a pipeline, officials said.
articles.title: Russian drone attack damages energy installations in Ukraine's Odesa

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: Austrian prosecutors have asked parliament to lift far-right leader Herbert Kickl's immunity over an allegation that he committed perjury testifying to a parliamentary committee, the office of the lower house's speaker confirmed on Thursday.
articles.title: Austrian prosecutors ask parliament to lift far-right leader's immunity
